intro: Meyeria parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved Meyeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Meyeria parvifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
